comments.body: Is it fine to have this date set to midnight **at the web browser's timezone**?

Yeah, I think so ğŸ¤”. This way we'll display the data at the same timezone used in the other charts. Otherwise, we'd have to move all the charts timezones to UTC, which I think makes everything more "consistent", BUT it could be confusing for most users, right? Since some dates could be shown 1 day earlier (compared to the dates from their timezones).

But if we're keeping this date at the web browser's timezone, I think we should remove the UTC conversion from `currentDate`, wdyt?
